푸리 얼그레이 무설탕 쨈

I've quit eating candy and desserts earlier in my life for about 2 years and after a while I couldn't eat any candy because it was just too sweet for my taste. I had eaten bananas whenever I craved something sweet (which happened rarely then) and even green bananas tasted very sweet. 
Sadly, after 2 years, I had gradually started eating more foods that contained sugar and eventually I picked up on eating candy as well. 
This video motivates me to go back and just quit on candy and desserts again because right now, I'm already always checking ingredient lists and buying the products with less sugar in it. 

And I can say that Una is right because my skin was not only better but also I felt much more healthy and energetic. 
Good luck from Germany to all of you cutting down your sugar intake! You can do it!  🥰💕

I watched this video before I started becoming unwell again. My body itchy skin condition recurred last month. Of course my face skin has always been terrible. I realised it's probably because of my yeast allergy and sensitivity - altho i found out about my yeast allergy a couple years ago, the doctor never explained it to me or recommended anything, and i was too stubborn about giving up bread to try to understand it. I probably ruined my health by ignoring it, so I'm going to assume I might be sensitive to sugar intake as well. I was so upset and stressed last week, I kept trying to google information online, which some are contradictory on what I should or shouldn't eat. Anyways, I've cheered up a bit now. I'm still really sad I cant eat what I used to, with your video now it'll encourage me that hopefully my skin will improve at least a bit. Thankyou. I do think one will save some money going sugarless bc there is much less you can buy or eat. But it's seems unfair I have to spend more money on a sugar free yoghurt or yeast free bread. But it is the same as being born with problem-prone skin, allergies, disease and illness. Unlucky in human life i guess.
